item.title: Four Sign Celebratory Form for Men’s Basketball Class of 2029
item.description: TROY, NY - The Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute (RPI) men’s basketball team, led by 11th year head coach Mark Gilbride, will welcome four freshmen to campus this fall. Noah Daniel, Kellen Driscoll, Zach Hart and Payne Wood all recently signed Division III Celebratory Forms in honor of their intentions to attend RPI and join the men’s basketball program.

item.title: EMPAC Multimedia Performance: Will Not Be Composed
item.description: October 20-24, 2025 We Will Not Be Composed is a multimedia performance created in collaboration with saxophonist and composer Stevie Manning, author and activist Soraya Chemaly, and new media artist Xuan to challenge perceptions of women’s anger in America. Manning and an ensemble of musicians build and rehearse the world premiere performance of the work utilizing the advanced spatial audio, video, and stage technologies of EMPAC Studio 1—Goodman.

item.title: RPI Women’s Soccer Pre-Game Tailgate, East Campus Athletic Village
item.description: Date: 8/29/2025 1:00 PM to 3:30 PM We’re excited to kick off the 2025 season with a Pre-Game Tailgate and hope you’ll join us for a fun and casual afternoon before rooting on RPIWS as we take on Suffolk University! Current and former families, alumnae, and friends of RPIWS are invited! This is a great chance to meet new families, reconnect with old, and celebrate the start of another exciting season. We’ll have food, games, music, and plenty of team spirit. Let’s Go Red!

item.title: Change in Faculty/Staff Meal Plan Option
item.description: As part of our ongoing efforts to streamline services, changes in meal pricing and offering greater flexibility, we will transition fully to the Community RAD (Rensselaer Account Dollars) system at the start of the Fall 2025 Semester as the primary dining option for faculty and staff. For more information or to set up your Community RAD account, please visit the Campus Card Website, or contact the Campus Card Office at 518-276-6670 or email at campuscard@rpi.edu.

item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Seminar: “Connect Through Conversations” Part 1
item.description:
Much of a leader’s work is accomplished through daily conversations with team members and others. These interactions, especially the tough ones, often involve intensely personal feelings (on both sides) that have an impact on the practical outcome of the conversation and the personal connection between the leader and the person.
